meanings.definition: The act of ceding back or returning something, especially territory or rights.
meanings.sent1: The retrocession of the land to its original owners brought joy to the community.
meanings.sent2: The retrocession of the stolen artifact to the museum was a significant event.
meanings.sent3: After much negotiation, the retrocession of the disputed land was finally agreed upon.
meanings.sent4: The retrocession of power from the dictator to the people marked a new era of freedom.
meanings.sent5: The retrocession of control over the company led to positive changes in management.

meanings.definition: The act of transferring insurance risk from one insurer to another.
meanings.sent1: The retrocession of the insurance policy to a different company was a strategic move.
meanings.sent2: The retrocession of the liability to a reinsurer helped spread the risk.
meanings.sent3: The retrocession of the insurance coverage surprised many in the industry.
meanings.sent4: The retrocession of the policy to a more experienced insurer proved beneficial.
meanings.sent5: The retrocession of the risk to a specialized firm ensured better protection.

meanings.definition: The act of giving up or surrendering something, typically in a formal manner.
meanings.sent1: The retrocession of his title was a noble gesture of humility.
meanings.sent2: The retrocession of her authority was met with mixed reactions.
meanings.sent3: The retrocession of the crown was a dramatic moment in the royal history.
meanings.sent4: The retrocession of the trophy symbolized the end of an era.
meanings.sent5: The retrocession of his position was a selfless act of sacrifice.
